derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (denoting a dish made with oatmeal or wheatmeal boiled to a jelly): from Welsh llymru; perhaps related to llymrig 'soft, slippery'

means.word_mean: 1. a bland custard or pudding especially of oatmeal

auth_sentence.content: Well, actually, it wasn't for everyone; that was flummery.

auth_sentence.content: Some people prefer a life of puffed up flummery, gladly ignoring the harm it inflicts on others.

abbreviation.mean_en: foolish humbuggery (named after British custard made of flour or oatmeal boiled with water until almost too thick to swallow)
